DOC.brief_summary: This study hopes to determine if thromboelastography-derived functional fibrinogen (TEG-FF) levels on cardiopulmary bypass during cardiac surgery can provide information on coagulation status sooner, allowing for anticipation of post-bypass bleeding and transfusion requirements
DOC.criteria: Elective cardiac surgery patients who are undergoing primary cardiac surgery Emergency surgery Reoperative cardiac surgery History of hypercoagulable state as defined in medical record Anticoagulated status at time of surgery Plasma requirement prior to discontinuation of bypass (alters fibrinogen level)
